description: A massive city built on water, known as the shipbuilding capital of the world. The city features an intricate canal system with waterways serving as roads, and citizens use yagara bulls (seahorse-like creatures) for transportation. Water 7 is famous for its skilled shipwrights and the prestigious Galley-La Company.

keyEvents.title: Straw Hats Navigate Water 7's Canals
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hat Pirates explore Water 7 by riding yagara bulls through the city's unique roller coaster-like canal system.
keyEvents.significance: First exploration of the shipbuilding capital, introducing the crew to the city that will become central to their story.

keyEvents.title: Water 7's Unusual Friendliness
keyEvents.description: The Straw Hats notice the residents' unusual friendliness toward pirates, reflecting the city's confidence in its shipwrights' ability to protect them.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes Water 7's unique culture and the power dynamic between citizens and visiting pirates.

culturalSignificance: Water 7 is the world's shipbuilding capital, home to the most skilled shipwrights in the One Piece world. The city's entire economy and culture revolve around ship construction and repair.
politicalStatus: Independent city-state led by Mayor Iceburg
climate: Temperate with annual Aqua Laguna (massive tidal wave)
realWorldInspiration: Venice, Italy - The canal-based city structure and water transportation system are directly inspired by Venice's famous waterways and gondola system.

name.japanese: ウォーターセブンの運河

description: The intricate network of waterways that serve as Water 7's transportation system. These canals feature roller coaster-like elevations and sluice-gate elevators, creating a unique and thrilling method of travel throughout the city.

keyEvents.title: First Ride Through Water 7's Canals
keyEvents.description: Luffy, Nami, and Usopp ride yagara bulls through the canal system, experiencing the roller coaster-like channels.
keyEvents.significance: Introduction to Water 7's unique transportation infrastructure.

culturalSignificance: The canals are the lifeblood of Water 7, enabling all transportation and commerce throughout the city.
realWorldInspiration: Venice's canal system combined with water park ride elements

name.japanese: ガレーラカンパニー 第1ドック

description: The primary shipbuilding dock of the Galley-La Company, Water 7's most prestigious shipbuilding organization. This massive facility is where the company's best shipwrights work and where they demonstrate their combat capabilities against troublesome pirates.

keyEvents.title: Big Helmet Pirates Refuse Payment
keyEvents.description: Mikazuki and his crew refuse to pay for ship repairs at Dock 1, leading to confrontation.
keyEvents.significance: Sets up the demonstration of Galley-La's power.

keyEvents.title: Galley-La Defeats Big Helmet Pirates
keyEvents.description: The shipwrights of Dock 1 easily defeat the Big Helmet Pirates using a cannon and their combat skills.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the formidable nature of Galley-La's workers and their role in protecting Water 7.

culturalSignificance: Dock 1 is the flagship location of the world's most prestigious shipbuilding company, representing the pinnacle of the craft.

name.japanese: ウォーターセブンの裏通り

description: The back street market district of Water 7, featuring shops including bookstores and various market stalls. This area also hosts carnival participants with masks, creating a festive but somewhat mysterious atmosphere.

keyEvents.title: Masked Figure Whispers 'CP9' to Robin
keyEvents.description: While exploring the back streets, Robin encounters a masked carnival participant (Blueno) who whispers 'CP9' to her.
keyEvents.significance: The pivotal moment that triggers the entire Water 7/Enies Lobby arc, as Robin's past catches up with her.

keyEvents.title: Robin's Mysterious Disappearance
keyEvents.description: Robin vanishes from the back streets while Chopper is briefly in a bookstore.
keyEvents.significance: Marks the beginning of Robin's disappearance and the crew's desperate search for her.

culturalSignificance: Represents the commercial heart of Water 7 where residents shop and socialize.
realWorldInspiration: European market districts and carnival celebrations

description: The Straw Hat Pirates' beloved ship, a caravel-type vessel, currently docked at Water 7. The ship has taken significant damage over their journey and the crew has come to Water 7 seeking repairs.

keyEvents.title: Franky Family Attacks the Going Merry
keyEvents.description: Zambai leads Franky Family members in an attack on the docked Going Merry, attempting to capture Zoro.
keyEvents.significance: First conflict between the Straw Hats and the Franky Family, occurring on the ship that will soon be at the center of the arc's emotional core.

keyEvents.title: Zoro Defends the Going Merry
keyEvents.description: Zoro defeats the attackers while protecting the ship.
keyEvents.significance: Shows the crew's dedication to protecting their ship, foreshadowing the emotional attachment that will be tested in this arc.

culturalSignificance: The Going Merry is the Straw Hats' first ship and irreplaceable home, representing their journey together.

statusHistory.description: Docked at Water 7 in need of major repairs

realWorldInspiration: Small historical caravels and sailing ships
